name: Beef Burgers with Sweet Potato Chips Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Cut up all your veggies. Dice your onion, finely chop your garlic, chop up your parsley, shred your lettuce, slice your tomato and pickles. Cut the sweet potato into wedges, leave the skin off or on, up to you. If leaving on just make sure you give it a good scrub and clean

Add your sweet potato to a baking tray and add half the olive oil, salt, coat each wedge, add more oil if you feel it needs, Add to your preheated 180Â°C oven to cook. Give the wedges a gentle mix after about 20 mins to cook evenly
Add you beef mince to a bowl with all the parsley and 1/2 your diced onion, salt and pepper and egg. Mix really well, keep mixing until it comes together. Shape into patties and set aside

Add your remaining oil to a medium side fry pan and bring to a medium heat. Add your patties, you should hear a gentle sizzle. Cook your patties, turning every 5 mins to get an even brown crust. Check on your sweet potato

Once patties are cooked, you can start to assemble your burgers. Turn your oven off at the this stage if your sweet potatoes are cooked. Depending on how thick or thin you slice them, will vary in cooking time. I cut mine a medium size
Open your brioche buns, starting at base, add cheese, pattie, lettuce, pickle, tomato, onion, garlic aioli, and top of brioche
